object.name: Rightside Down -- Blank Moving Wood Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a blank surface.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Rightside Down -- Checkered Moving Wood Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a checker patterned surface.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Rightside Down -- Intro Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The decorative building blocks planet that can be seen at the beginning of Rightside Down Galaxy.

object.name: Air Bubble
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bubble that restores the player's air when collected underwater.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A stationary bubble that replenishes air when collected underwater. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

object.name: Air Bubble Generator
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A nozzle that periodically generates air bubbles.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A nozzle that periodically generates several air bubbles that replenish the player's air when underwater.

field.name: Delay
field.notes: Time between bubble spawns in frames.

field.name: Duration
field.notes: Life duration of a single bubble in frames.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Luma Cage
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The red metal cage from Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Underwater Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large planet found in the 2D underwater section from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Sea Mine Plant
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large planet found in Cosmic Cove Galaxy's 2D section that features Jammyfish and Sea Mines.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- Moving Gate
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A moving metal gate from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Collision Push Movement Area [Sphere]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Moves compatible objects if they are on AreaMove collision triangles.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Moves compatible objects inside this area if they are bound to a floor triangle with the collision type AreaMove. Compatible objects are the player itself, BombBird and its bombs, Kuribo, Karon and CocoNut.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

object.name: Arrow Sign
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large arrow-shaped sign with a red outline.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Arrow Switch
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating switch object that can be activated using Spin Attacks.

field.name: Rotation Direction
field.notes: Specifies the rotation when hit.
field.values: -1 = 180° to right or left, 0 = 90° to left, 1 = 90° to right, 2 = 180° to left, 3 = 180° to right

field.name: Activation Mode
field.notes: If enabled, it cannot be hit again util the SW_A event deactivates again.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets shadow drop length.

object.name: Blue Space Junk Block
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A square-shaped Space Junk block.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Remains at a resting position that can be defined by linking a GeneralPos with the name 合体ブロック故郷点 to it. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur".

field.name: Activation Range
field.notes: Specifies the activation range to Mario's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

field.name: Activation Time
field.notes: If Obj_arg7 is set, this specifies the timer until the block disappears again.

field.name: Is Timed?
field.notes: If enabled, the block will be activated for a set amount of time only.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Texture Frame

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock [Fight]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow orb that appears during the boss fights against Bowser.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves.

field.name: Bowser Encounter Number
field.notes: If greater than 1, the rock will emit a purple quake wave once it lands.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock [Final Fight]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow orb that appears during the final boss fight against Bowser.
-- CLASS NOTES -- These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser.

field.name: First Appearance Delay
field.notes: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock [Stage]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow orb that appears before the fights against Bowser.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rock that emits from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb. It can be smashed into KoopaSeals.

object.name: Audio Effect Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Enables a different audio effect once entered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

field.name: Effect Type
field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Starship Mario -- Rosalina's Comet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large egg-shaped Comet that appears during Starship Mario's ending cutscene.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and a maximum far clipping distance. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Mattermouth
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A gluttonous skull enemy from Haunty Halls Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A skull that moves around freely or on a set path. It "eats" away parts of objects that are compatible with ClipDrawArea. This enemy cannot be defeated in any way. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Small Rotating Carpet Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES --
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Lava Lair -- Mattermouth Carpet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large carpet from Bowser's Lava Lair that is eaten away by Mattermouths.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Porcupuffer
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A purple blowfish enemy from Drip Drop Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A blowfish enemy that inflates once Mario gets in its range. It will then home on to Mario and explode after a certain amount of time. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

object.name: Blimp Fruit
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The blue fruit that Yoshi can eat to expand and fly like a balloon.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

object.name: Generic Star Ball Opener
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A metal hole with a blue edge that is used to crack Star Balls in Rolling Greens Galaxy and Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open.

object.name: Rolling Coaster -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The round planet from Rolling Coaster Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A pink pencil platform from Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If Mario rides a Star Ball and touches this object's center, it will pull the Star Ball towards the center. Then, the Star Ball will be cracked open.

object.name: Star Ball Rail
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An invisible path that the Star Ball will move on once touched.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An invisible rail for the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning.

field.name: Acceleration
field.notes: Acceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 1500.

field.name: Deceleration
field.notes: Deceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 995.

object.name: Galaxy Generator -- Cloud Flower Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The planet from Bowser's Galaxy Generator's section that features Cloud Flowers and Bullet Bills.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A rotating cylinder from Bowser's Galaxy Generator that has some small platforms attached to it. Used in the section that features Cloud Flowers and Bullet Bills.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.notes:

object.name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Interior
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The interior parts of the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Sky Station -- Rotating Metal Lift
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A rotating cylinder that has four smaller platforms attached to it. It can be found inside the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Sky Station -- Cylindrical Banzai Bill Planet Exterior
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The exterior parts of the large cylindrical planet from Sky Station Galaxy's second Star.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Space Storm -- Long Cylindrical Satellite Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The long cylindrical satellite planet from Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Space Storm -- Small Moving Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small moving platform from Space Storm Galaxy's long cylindrical satellite planet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Space Storm -- Rotating Metal Lift
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The rotating metal lift from Space Storm Galaxy's long cylindrical satellite planet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Space Storm Foggy Atmosphere
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The gray foggy air that surrounds the cylindrical planets in Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during Intro?
field.notes: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

field.name: Always Active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Swooper
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bat enemy that is mostly found in cave sections.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. It will fly towards Mario if he comes in their range. They will fly towards Mario to attack him. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze Mario if touched, provided that Mario is not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Ice Swooper
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An icy Swooper that can freeze the player upon contact. Can be defeated using Ice Mario's attacks or the Invincibility power-up.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. It will fly towards Mario if he comes in their range. They will fly towards Mario to attack him. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze Mario if touched, provided that Mario is not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Whomp
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large rectangular stone block enemy that can attack by falling onto the player.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees Mario, it will move towards him to fall down on him. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma. It will spawn 7 Star Bits if defeated.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting Mario.

field.name: Spawn no Star Bits?
field.notes: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.

object.name: Whomp King
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large stone block boss from Throwback Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large stone block boss. He can summon Whimps that will try to attack Mario like Whomps do. The boss himself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like his smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto Mario to attack him. He can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, Mario can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage him. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. He always spawns a Power Star. He uses two GeneralPos. バッタンキング基準位置 is used as his position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position Mario after the battle. Several messages are also required. BattanKing000 specifies the introduction text. BattanKing001 specifies the text after defeating him. Lastly, the actual cutscenes have to be specified as well: バッタンキング登場 for the opening and バッタンキングダウン for the outro.

field.name: Camera Register Starting Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.

object.name: Gravity Gauntlet -- Whomp Section Parts
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Parts of the Whomp section and the last 2D interior section from Bowser's Gravity Gauntlet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Bee Eater
object.notes:

-- CLASS NOTES -- A stretchy plant with spikes that will lunge onto Mario to damage him. Cannot be defeated, however, they can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit at them.

object.name: Rotating Flower Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A rotating flower platform that can be stood on using the Bee and Cloud power-ups.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating platform that can be stood on using the Bee power-up. If the player does not have any of these two power-ups and touches the platform, it will temporarily disappear.

field.name: Rotation Speed
field.notes: Sets the rotation's speed.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

object.name: Red Honeybloom Berry
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.

object.name: Pink Honeybloom Berry
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.

object.name: Purple Honeybloom Berry
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.

object.name: Yellow Honeybloom Berry
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- One of the many bouncy berries from Honeybloom Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bouncy berry that can be bounced off by Bee Mario. If touched by Mario while he does not have the Bee power-up, it will pop and reappear after about three seconds.

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Makes Bee Mario fly a longer distance than usual if the player is inside this area.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual.

object.name: Topmini
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small yellow robot enemy that is always spinning.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A small robot enemy that will make Mario spin around if touched. However, it can be defeated using Spin Attacks. If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It can be defeated by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Topmini Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black hole that spawns Topmini. Defeated Topmini will respawn after some time.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Spring Topman Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black hole that spawns Spring Topman. Defeated Spring Topman will respawn after some time.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Spiky Topman
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A red spiky robot enemy that is always spinning.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating robot enemy that will make Mario spin around if touched. If Mario touches its spiky head, he will take damage. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Spring Topman
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow robot enemy whose head can be bounced off.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which Mario can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until Mario gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Passive Spring Topman
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A variant of a Spring Topman that resides in the ground and jumps out once the player gets near. It emits a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which Mario can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until Mario gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Gobblegut
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The dragon boss from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flottila.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦） to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See BellyDragonLv1Zone for a better look inside the cutscene.

object.name: Fiery Flotilla -- Gobblegut Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The planet from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla where Gobblegut is fought.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Fiery Gobblegut
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A fiery version of Gobblegut that appears in Battle Belt Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦） to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See BellyDragonLv1Zone for a better look inside the cutscene.

object.name: Battle Belt -- Fiery Gobblegut Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The rocky planet from Battle Belt Galaxy where Fiery Gobblegut is fought.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The folding swamp planet from Boo Moon Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A special planet that can fold two times. Each state also has a separate collision mesh that gets loaded in. Usually, the planet will be in its unfolded state. SW_A and SW_B are used to fold it.

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Starting Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The starting platform from Boo Moon Galaxy's folding swamp planet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Midway Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The second platform from Boo Moon Galaxy's folding swamp planet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Boo Moon -- Folding Swamp Curved Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The curved platform from Boo Moon Galaxy's folding swamp planet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Rainbow Star
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A collectable power-up that transforms Mario into Rainbow Mario.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An item that grants Mario the Invincibility power-up when collected.

field.name: Appearance Type
field.notes: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
field.values: -1 = Invisible, 1 = On ground after 1 second, 2 = Thrown out, 3 = Thrown out from ? Block, 4 = On ground immediately (SMG2 only)

field.name: Clipping Type
field.notes: Specifies the clipping type.
field.values: -1 = None, 1 = Spherical

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length. Default 2000.

object.name: Life Mushroom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A collectable mushroom that increases the player's health to 6.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An item that increases the player's health to 6 when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Appearance Type
field.notes: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
field.values: -1 = Invisible, 1 = On ground after 1 second, 2 = Thrown out, 3 = Thrown out from ? Block, 4 = On ground immediately (SMG2 only)

field.name: Clipping Type
field.notes: Specifies the clipping type.
field.values: -1 = None, 1 = Spherical

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

object.name: 1-Up Mushroom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A collectable mushroom that gives an extra life.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An item that grants the player an extra life when collected. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Appearance Type
field.notes: Specifies how the item appears after appearing.
field.values: -1 = Invisible, 1 = On ground after 1 second, 2 = Thrown out, 3 = Thrown out from ? Block, 4 = On ground immediately (SMG2 only)

field.name: Clipping Type
field.notes: Specifies the clipping type.
field.values: -1 = None, 1 = Spherical

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

object.name: Flipsville Blue Cloudy Atmosphere
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large cloudy air that surrounds the Starshroom and Glamdozer planet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Hungry Luma Atmosphere
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The pink atmosphere that surrounds the planets created after feeding a Hungry Luma.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during Intro?
field.notes: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

field.name: Always Active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Rightside Down Sky

-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Music Change Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Changes the stage's background music in various different ways if entered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Changes the background music using the stage's music information in StageBgmInfo. Supports several different changing modes.

field.name: Change Type
field.notes: The music change type.
field.values: 0 = Change Song, 1 = Fade-out and Change Song, 2 = Change State

field.name: Argument 1
field.notes: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 0. ChangeBgmState index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 2. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 1.

field.name: Argument 2
field.notes: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 1. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 2.

field.name: Comet Music Type
field.notes: Sets how music changes are handled during Comet missions.
field.values: -1 = Music change is ignored during Comet, 1 = Music change is enforced during Comet

object.name: Music Volume Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Changes the background music's volume if entered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- When Mario enters this area, the music's volume will be changed. The volume resets if the player leaves the area again.

field.name: Fade Time
field.notes: The music's fade time in frames. Default is 90.

field.name: Volume
field.notes: The music's volume multiplied by 100.

object.name: Big Amp
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An electric ball-shaped enemy that moves on a set path.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

field.name: Shadow Type
field.notes: Sets the shadow type.
field.values: -1 = Validate shadows, 1 = Invalidate shadows

object.name: Ending Credits -- Cake
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The big cake that can be seen during the game's ending credits.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.notes:

field.name: Wind Length

object.notes:

object.name: Large Cloud Particles
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large cloud effect used in a few galaxies, such as Wild Glide Galaxy and Freezy Flake Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Amp
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small electrical enemy that moves on a path or in a circular motion.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A small electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

field.name: Side Type
field.notes: Specifies the side direction.
field.values: -1 = Side is path direction, 1 = Opposite of path direction

field.name: Shadow Type
field.notes: Sets the shadow type.
field.values: -1 = Validate shadows, 1 = Invalidate shadows

field.name: Gravity Type
field.notes: Specifies the gravity calculation type.
field.values: -1 = Ignore gravity, 0 = Negated gravity is up. Always calculate gravity, 1 = Negated gravity is up. Calculate gravity once

object.name: Black Hole [Spherical Attraction]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a spherical attraction range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that sucks in Mario and some compatible objects if they enter a black hole's range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0.

field.name: Model Scale
field.notes: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

object.name: Black Hole [Cubic Attraction]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a box-shaped attraction range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that sucks in Mario and some compatible objects if they enter a black hole's range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0.

field.name: Model Scale
field.notes: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

object.name: Bloom Effect Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enables model bloom.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively.

field.name: Intensity
field.notes: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.

field.name: Threshold
field.notes: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.

field.name: Intensity 1
field.notes: Primary intensity argument.

field.name: Intensity 2
field.notes: Secondary intensity argument.

object.name: "BloomFlower" [Broken]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An unused class that does not work properly due to a programming error. Normally, it is meant to grow if it's in Bulb Yoshi's light range. This would make a Star Bit appear as well. However, the developers messed up a nerve check, so this effect is never triggered. If it's outside Bulb Yoshi's light, however, it will wither again.

object.name: Honeybloom Sky
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The sky model used in Honeybloom Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Pull Star Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A transparent planet with a Pull Star inside; used in Space Junk Galaxy, Ghostly Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Planet-like objects that feature a large Pull Star inside them. The player can use the pointer on the Pull Star to make it attract Mario. UFOBlueStarCupsule is hardcoded to use a lower target radius.

object.name: Pull Star Explanation Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that, if entered, notifies the player how to use Pull Stars.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If Mario stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Pull Stars.

object.name: Bomb
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bomb that can be picked-up (to light its fuse) and thrown.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees Mario. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

field.name: Countdown
field.notes: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.

field.name: Explosion Range
field.notes: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f

object.name: Cluckboom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A fat bird that drops bombs; used in Dusty Dune Galaxy and Slipsand Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bird enemy that flies on a path. If Mario gets near it, it will drop a bomb that explodes after some seconds. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit on it. Can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Flies Higher?
field.notes: If enabled, it will fly far above the actual path. Also disables clipping.

object.name: Bob-omb
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bomb enemy that explodes after a few seconds (once its fuse is lit).
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees Mario. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

field.name: Countdown
field.notes: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.

field.name: Explosion Range
field.notes: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f

object.name: Bob-omb Dispenser
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An enemy dispenser that releases Bob-ombs.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A dispenser that releases bombs or Bob-ombs. If the object is named BombLauncher, it creates bombs whereas it creates Bob-ombs when it's called BombHeiLauncher. There can only be one bomb or Bob-omb at once.

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The interior of the cylindrical glass planet from Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Space Storm -- Bob-omb Planet Exterior
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The exterior of the cylindrical glass planet from Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Bob-omb Buddy
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A red Bob-omb NPC from Throwback Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A friendly Bob-omb NPC that can be talked to.

object.name: Bomb Dispenser
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A dispenser that releases bombs.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A dispenser that releases bombs or Bob-ombs. If the object is named BombLauncher, it creates bombs whereas it creates Bob-ombs when it's called BombHeiLauncher. There can only be one bomb or Bob-omb at once.

object.name: Bomb Boo
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black boo that explodes when it hits something; used in Ghostly Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Boo variant that can be swung around using its tongue. It can be smashed into several objects to damage or destroy them. If the player swings it around and does not get rid of it after some time, it will blink red and explode.

field.name: Disable Respawning?
field.notes: Disables respawning after it dies.

object.name: Gearmo Challenge Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The planet used for the trash minigame in Battle Rock Galaxy and the crate-burning minigames in Super Mario Galaxy 2.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Red Gravity Indicator Wall
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A red wall piece that is used to indicate the direction of gravity in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Boomerang Bro
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A blue Koopa that throws boomerangs.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Koopa Troopa that throws boomerangs to attack the player. These boomerangs can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives Mario the advantage to attack it. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma as well.

field.name: Starting Delay
field.notes: The delay until it starts jumping around.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: Specifies how items should be spawned.
field.values: -1 = Spawn any items, 0 = Don't spawn any items

field.name: Connect to MapObj?
field.notes: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.

object.name: Glamdozer
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The boss used at the end of the first mission of Flipsville Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A dinosaur-like boss that sleeps until Mario Ground Pounds the weak spot on her belly. Excluding the first time, the player has to damage her three times. Starting the second phase, she will shoot fire balls that can temporarily cover manhole grates in lava. During the last phase, she will turn red and move faster. She is supposed to be placed on a disk-like planet as she can freely walk around such planets and change sides. She uses two GeneralPos. ボスブッスン位置 is used as her position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position Mario after the battle. She always spawns a Power Star which needs to be set up in the galaxy's Scenario file.

object.name: Flipsville -- Glamdozer Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The planet used at the end of the first mission of Flipsville Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Giga-Lakitu
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The boss fought at the end of the second mission of Yoshi-Star Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large variant of a Lakitu that wears glasses and rides on a purple cloud. He throws Spinys at Mario and may also use thunderbolts to attack him. When he throws Spinys, he will be moving on a path whereas he moves between two separate points when using the thunderbolt attack. He can be damaged by thrown Shells or Yoshi projectiles. After dealing three hits, he will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file. This object also uses several GeneralPos. ジュゲム突進点１ and ジュゲム突進点２ are used as the right and left points that it moves between when using the thunderbolt attack. カメラ基準点 is used as the orientation point that the camera will look at most of the time. ボスジュゲムデモ位置 defines the position of the intro cutscene. ボスジュゲムダウンデモ位置 defines the position of the defeated cutscene.

field.name: Camera Register Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the vector register cameras.

object.name: Yoshi-Star -- Giga-Laktiu Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The planet used at the end of the second mission of Yoshi-Star Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Giga-Lakitu Background Clouds
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The decorative thunder clouds seen in the background of the Giga-Lakitu fight in Yoshi-Star Galaxy. They can cause damage as well.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A set of clouds. If SW_A is triggered, they will turn gray. In this state, they will deal electric damage to the player and compatible enemies. Once the switch is deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

object.name: Bugaboom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The boss fought in both the third mission of Honeyhive Galaxy and in the secret mission of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large bug-like boss that can be damaged by Ground Pounding the weak spot on its back. It needs to be damaged three times. During the first phase, it moves slowly on the ground. After taking the first hit, it starts flying. And in the last phase, its skin turns red and it will make aggressive turns while it flies. While it flies, it will periodically drop explosive bombs that can hurt the player. After it is defeated, it will spawn a Power Star, which also requires changes to the galaxy's Scenario file.

field.name: Camera Register Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the vector and matrix register cameras.

object.name: Small Breakable Glass Cage
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small breakable glass cage.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A destroyable obstacle that can be destroyed using Koopa Shells, Yoshi's projectiles or any enemy attack except enemy fire damage. Most of its variants can contain an item. Except for Star Bits and Power Stars, the items are only cosmetic. If the item is set to Power Star, the object also requires a proper setup in the galaxy's Scenario file.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Delay SW_DEAD activation?
field.notes: When enabled, SW_DEAD will be activated immediately instead of having to wait for the breaking animation to finish.

field.name: Play Riddle SFX?
field.notes: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.

field.name: Toad/Luma Color
field.notes: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 5 Star Bits and Power Stars can be spawned directly.
field.values: -1 = Nothing, 0 = Coin, 1 = Toad, 2 = Sling Star, 3 = Launch Star, 4 = Star Bits, 5 = Luma, 6 = Key, 7 = Power Star, 8 = 1-Up Mushroom, 9 = Goomba, 10 = Blue Star Chip, 11 = Yellow Star Chip, 12 = Silver Star, 13 = Grand Star, 14 = Life Mushroom

object.name: Gearmo Enemy Checker
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An object used to check if the player brings the correct enemy to the Gearmo in Boulder Bowl Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- This registers and controls the enemies requested by a CareTakerHunter. This object is usually linked to a CareTakerHunter using GeneratorId. Otherwise, it's useless on its own. The requested enemies can be attached to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. Supported enemies are Kuribo, TogeBegomanLauncher, BegomanLauncher and BegomanBabyLauncher.

The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Butterfly
object.notes:

field.name: Color
field.notes: Sets the BRK color frame.
field.values: -1 = Orange with purple outline, 1 = Dark red with blue outline, 2 = Red with navy blue outline, 3 = Bright green with yellow outline

field.name: Disable Star Bits?
field.notes: Does not spawn a Star Bit when touched.

-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during Intro?
field.notes: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

field.name: Always Active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The iconic pipe used to warp Mario from one place to another.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.
field.values: -1 = Green, 1 = Orange

object.name: Underwater Warp Pipe
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Warp Pipe with a vortex that sucks in Mario if he is nearby.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push Mario upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.
field.values: -1 = Green, 1 = Orange

object.name: Decorative Warp Pipe
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A decorative Warp Pipe that cannot be entered. Used in the game's intro.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Flaming Volcano
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The flaming volcano used in Shiverburn Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Bullet Bill Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bullet-like enemy that may home on to Mario if he gets in its range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range Mario has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing)
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

object.name: Li'l Brr
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A burning rock enemy that floats around and chases after Mario. It will freeze the player upon contact.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An enemy that can damage the player upon contact. Can be stunned with a Spin Attack which reveals its core. The core can be destroyed by most of Mario's actions.

field.name: Appearance
field.notes: Initial nerve state.
field.values: -1 = Wait, 0 = Runaway, 1 = Float

field.name: Respawn
field.notes: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.

-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow tile used on the Comet of Mario Squared Galaxy, instead of the Flipswitches.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Banzai Bill Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Generates larger versions of Bullet Bills.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range Mario has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing)
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

-- CLASS NOTES -- A controller that sets the spawn point for Mario at the start of a mission and at Checkpoints in a mission. May also be used for other things such as the warp areas on the Comet Observatory. If placed in a generic object placement file, this will create a glitchy clone of Mario.

field.name: Entrance Type
field.notes: Defines how Mario enters the scene.
field.values: -1 = Spinning, 1 = Standing, 2 = Walking In

object.name: Sweet Mystery -- Decorative Donuts, Pancakes, etc.
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A set of decorative donuts, pancakes and more used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Smoking Meteor
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A decorative meteor that creates smoke effects; used in the prologue at Peach's Castle.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Extended Item Sensor Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area which extends the sensor range when trying to collect items along the camera's view direction. For example, this allows Mario to collect an item while he stands behind or in front of it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that extends Mario's sensor range to detect item. This allows Mario to collect an item while he stands closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

object.name: Extended Item Sensor Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area which extends the sensor range when trying to collect items along the camera's view direction. For example, this allows Mario to collect an item while he stands behind or in front of it. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that extends Mario's sensor range to detect item. This allows Mario to collect an item while he stands closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

object.name: Disable Movement Direction Retention Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- This area adjusts the player's movement direction to the current camera angle instead of keeping the direction the joystick was held in before moving.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that adjusts the player's movement direction all the time. Usually, when a camera change occurs, Mario will keep walking into the direction the stick was held before the camera changed. This prevents exactly this.

object.name: Enable Ice Collision Rescue Position Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enables saving the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision as a safe rescuing position.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Normally, when Mario falls into a PullBackArea, he won't be returned to the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision. Instead, the game treats several other collision types as safe rescuing positions. However, this area ignores the check for these two collision types so that these collision triangles are treated as proper rescuing positions.

object.name: Flip-Swap -- Starting Platforms
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A set of platforms used as the starting planet of Flip-Swap Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

field.name: Color
field.notes: Color of the Star Bits.
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = White

field.name: Number of Star Bits
field.notes: Amount of Star Bits to be distrbuted along the path or circle.

field.name: Circle radius
field.notes: Radius of the Star Bit circle, only used if a path has not been assigned.

field.name: Star Bit Color
field.notes: The color the Star Bits will be.
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = White

field.notes: Enables the two spiky rock obstacles.

field.name: Enable white color
field.notes: Starts the "White" color animation if enabled.

object.name: Cosmic Spirit

object.name: Launch Star
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.

field.name: Flight Time
field.notes: The amount of time the flight takes to complete (in frames). Default 300.

field.name: Shadow Drop Distance
field.notes: The distance to drop the shadow. Default -1.

field.name: Don't Grab Mario
field.notes: If set, the Launch Star won't pull mario towards it when he gets near.

field.name: Camera Count
field.notes: The number of Cameras to be read from the camera file.

field.name: No Appear Jingle
field.notes: If enabled, the usual Launch Star appear jingle will not play.

field.name: Landing Rotation
field.notes: The rotation that the player lands at. (NOTE: Needs further research as the rotation angle seems inconsistent)

field.name: Unknown 6
field.notes: Only used in Beach Bowl (SMG1)

field.name: SpinDriverPathStorage Index
field.notes: The index of this launch star's path in the internal SpinDriverPathStorage class. This Arg is read by both games but only functions in SMG1.

-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Torpedo Ted Spawner

-- CLASS NOTES -- A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range Mario has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing)
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

object.name: Star Chip
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A collectable yellow chip. Usually, five of them have to be collected.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A collectable yellow chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a YellowChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn something like a Launch Star.

field.name: Star Chip Group ID
field.notes: The ID of the YellowChipGroup this Star Chip is linked to.

field.name: Inside Bubble
field.notes: If checked, the chip will spawn inside an air bubble.

field.name: Shadow Drop Length
field.notes: The distance downwards that the object's shadow is projected.

field.name: Shadow Shape
field.notes: The shape of the object's shadow.
field.values: -1 = = Sphere, 0 = = Cylinder

object.name: Star Chip Group Controller
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Controls a collection of Star Chips and activates something once all are collected.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A controller which activates SW_A when all Star Chip (YellowChip) objects linked to it by the obj_arg0 value are collected. It is recommended to have groups of 5 Star Chips.
This controller is also responsible for displaying the Star Chip Counter layout at the top of the screen.

field.name: Group ID
field.notes: The ID of this group for Star Chips to link to.

field.name: Star Chip Counter Display Range
field.notes: The distance the player has to be within of this object for the Star Chip Counter to be displayed.
field.values: -1 = = Always display

field.name: Re-activate When Previously Activated
field.notes: If checked, re-activates SW_A upon a soft reload (ex: after a death) if already activated before.

object.name: "YoshiBlock" [Broken]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.

field.name: No shadow

field.name: No Yoshi Egg
field.notes: If checked, no Yoshi Egg is spawned, only the nest.
field.values: -1 = = false, 1 = = true

object.name: Magic Cage
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A magical cage created by a Magikoopa. It holds the Yoshi Egg in Yoshi Star Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Yoshi Star -- Stone Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The small stone platform where the player finds the Yoshi Egg in Yoshi Star Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Pink Fruit
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A pink fruit which can be eaten by Yoshi.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object which can be eatean by Yoshi and releases a Star Bit. If Yoshi eats ten of these, the player will be granted a 1-Up.
